data.name: Acidulated Malt
data.description: Lowers mash, wort, and beer pH. Contains 1-2% lactic acid. Enhances enzymatic activity in mash and improves extract efficiency. Lightens color in pale brews. Enhances stability and extends shelf life of finished beer. Promotes well-rounded, complex beer flavor.

characteristics.name: Head
characteristics.description: Helps the head retention of the beer.

data.name: Amber Malt
data.description: Roasted specialty malt used in some English browns, milds and old ales to add color and a biscuit taste. Intense flavour

characteristics.name: Biscuit
characteristics.description: Imparts a biscuity quality upon the beer.

data.name: Aromatic Malt
data.description: Aromatic malt is a kilned barley malt used to give beer a strong, aggressive malt aroma and rich color.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Barley - Black
data.description: Unmalted barley roasted at high temperature to create a dry, coffee-like flavor. Imparts the sharp, acrid flavor characteristic of dry stouts.  Gives dryness to a stout or porter -- much more so than regular Roasted Barley.

data.name: Barley - Roasted
data.description: Unmalted and roasted at high temperature to create a burnt, grainy, coffee-like flavor. Imparts a red to deep brown color to beer, and very strong roasted flavor. Use 2-4% in Brown ales to add a nutty flavor, or 3-10% in Porters and Stouts for coffee flavor.

characteristics.name: Burnt
characteristics.description: Imparts a burnt tasting quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Coffee
characteristics.description: Imparts a coffee flavor upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Grainy
characteristics.description: Imparts a grainty taste upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Nutty
characteristics.description: Imparts a nutty flavor upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Roasted
characteristics.description: Imparts a roasted flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Biscuit Malt
data.description: Another Belgian malt, this gives a biscuit like flavor and aroma. Use for English ales, brown ales and porters. Can be used as a substitute for toasted malt.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Biscuit
characteristics.description: Imparts a biscuity quality upon the beer.

data.name: Black Patent
data.description: Black patent malt, sometimes called simply black malt, is the darkest of the common roasted malts. It gives beer dark color and flavor with a very different character than roasted barley.

characteristics.name: Burnt
characteristics.description: Imparts a burnt tasting quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Roasted
characteristics.description: Imparts a roasted flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Brown Malt
data.description: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

characteristics.name: Biscuit
characteristics.description: Imparts a biscuity quality upon the beer.

data.name: Brumalt
data.description: Dark German malt developed to add malt flavor of Alt, Marzen and Oktoberfest beers. Helps create authentic maltiness without having to do a decoction mash. Rarely available for homebrewers.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

data.name: CaraAroma
data.description: Very dark crystal malt - similar to a crystal 120 or Caramunich 120 malt. Adds strong caramel flavor, red color, and malty aroma.

data.name: CaraPils/Dextrin Malt
data.description: Dextrine malt is a general term for a set of malts, including CaraPils and others, used to increase foam, head retention, sweetness, and body. Dextrine malts contain a lot of dextrins, sugar structures that are resistant to enzyme action that remain in the finished beer.

characteristics.name: Body
characteristics.description: Increases the body of the beer.

characteristics.name: Head
characteristics.description: Helps the head retention of the beer.

data.name: CaraPils/Dextrin Malt - Organic
data.description: Dextrine malt is a general term for a set of malts, including CaraPils and others, used to increase foam, head retention, sweetness, and body. Dextrine malts contain a lot of dextrins, sugar structures that are resistant to enzyme action that remain in the finished beer.

characteristics.name: Body
characteristics.description: Increases the body of the beer.

characteristics.name: Head
characteristics.description: Helps the head retention of the beer.

data.name: CaraRed
data.description: Carared is a trademarked name for a variety of crystal malt designed to add both flavor and a deep red color to beer. Also contributes to head retention.

characteristics.name: Body
characteristics.description: Increases the body of the beer.

characteristics.name: Head
characteristics.description: Helps the head retention of the beer.

data.name: CaraVienne Malt
data.description: A light Belgian crystal malt used in Trappist and Abbey style Belgian ales.

data.name: CaraWheat
data.description: Caramel wheat malt, also known by the Weyermann trademarked name Carawheat, is prepared by the same method as traditional barley crystal and caramel malt.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

data.name: Chocolate Malt
data.description: A dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and a nutty flavor, used in brown ales, porters, and some stouts.

characteristics.name: Chocolate
characteristics.description: Imparts a chocolate quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Coffee
characteristics.description: Imparts a coffee flavor upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Nutty
characteristics.description: Imparts a nutty flavor upon the beer.

data.description: Dextrine malt is a general term for a set of malts, including CaraPils and others, used to increase foam, head retention, sweetness, and body. Dextrine malts contain a lot of dextrins, sugar structures that are resistant to enzyme action that remain in the finished beer.

characteristics.name: Nutty

characteristics.name: Toasted

data.name: Chocolate Rye Malt
data.description: Primarily used for color and aroma in top-fermented speciality beers.

data.name: Chocolate Wheat Malt
data.description: Intensifies aroma and color in top-fermented beers such as dark wheat beers.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

data.name: Golden Promise
data.description: An early-maturing spring barley, it is the Scottish equivalent of Maris Otter. Though brewers north of the English border claim that its sweet, clean flavor is superior to Maris Otter. Golden Promise malt has a depth of flavor that makes it the ideal base malt for both UK and USA-style IPAs. Golden Promise is also used extensively by premium whisky distilleries such as The Macallan.

characteristics.name: Sweet
characteristics.description: Imparts a sweet flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Honey Malt
data.description: This Canadian malt imparts a honey-like flavor. It also also sometimes called Brumalt. Intensely sweet - adds a sweet malty flavor sometimes associated with honey.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Sweet
characteristics.description: Imparts a sweet flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Lager Malt
data.description: Very light lager malt used to make Pilsner, Lager and other light beers. May be used as a base malt.

data.name: Maris Otter
data.description: Maris Otter is an English thoroughbred and this winter barley variety is still the favored choice of many UK cask ale brewers. In the field, its yield has been surpassed hugely by more modern varieties, so it has to be grown on contract for the maltster each year by selected farmers. The resulting malt is typically described as having a rich, nutty flavor. Performance in the brewhouse is predictable and consistent with excellent run-offs.

characteristics.name: Nutty
characteristics.description: Imparts a nutty flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Melanoidin Malt
data.description: Aromatic malt from Bamberg, Germany. Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Mild Malt
data.description: Also called "English Mild" - a light specialty malt used in Brown Ales.

data.name: Munich Malt
data.description: Munich Malt has a malty sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. It has enough diastatic power to convert itself, but needs help from another malt, such as 2-row malt, to convert other grains.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Sweet
characteristics.description: Imparts a sweet flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Oats - Malted
data.description: Adds body, mouth feel and head retention to the beer Creates chill haze in lighter beers, so is primarily used in dark ones.

characteristics.name: Body
characteristics.description: Increases the body of the beer.

characteristics.name: Head
characteristics.description: Helps the head retention of the beer.

data.name: Pale Malt - Optic
data.description: Optic can be used as the main ingredient in Bitters, Milds and Stouts, producing consistent and well modified wort within the standard Ale colour range. The wort produced tends to be sweet and flavourful. Optic also produces highly aromatic qualities.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Sweet
characteristics.description: Imparts a sweet flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Peated Malt
data.description: A robust smoky malt used in Scottish and wee heavy ales.  This malt is lightly peated and used to enhance flavor in Scottish type ales. While the malt is in the kiln, peat moss outside the kiln is gently smoked over slow burning coals allowing its vapors to drift above the malt. Peated malt is also used in the making of some of Scotland's finest Scotch.

data.name: Rahr 2-Row Malt
data.description: Maillard Malts is proud to bring you this fantastic and economical all-purpose base malt. It is made from Harrington and Metcalf barley grown on the western prairies of the US and malted in Minnesota. It is low in total nitrogen, well modified, high in enzymes, and easily converts with a single step infusion mash. It has a light, clean, smooth flavor. One of our most popular base malts, it is perfect for building nearly any style ale. 1.7L

data.name: Six-Row Pale Malt
data.description: 6-Row is a base malt with a higher diastic power than 2-Row Malt to help convert other adjuncts. 6-Row has a moderate malty flavour.

data.name: Smoked Malt
data.description: Malt that has been smoked over an open fire to create a distinctive "smoked" flavor and aroma. Used primarily for German Rauchbier but can also be added to Brown Ales and Porters.

characteristics.name: Smoked
characteristics.description: Imparts a smoked quality upon the beer.

data.name: Special B Malt
data.description: Special B refers to a type of dark, flavorful crystal malt traditionally malted in Belgium. In small amounts, it gives a unique flavor to the finished beer that is often compared to raisins or dried fruit.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Caramel
characteristics.description: Imparts a caramel quality upon the beer.

data.name: Special Roast
data.description: Use for English ales, nut brown ales and porters. Adds a toasted, biscuit like flavor and aroma.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Biscuit
characteristics.description: Imparts a biscuity quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Toasted
characteristics.description: Imparts a toasted flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Toasted Malt
data.description: A malt that adds reddish orange color and body without adding sweetness.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Body
characteristics.description: Increases the body of the beer.

data.name: Two-Row Pale Malt
data.description: The is the standard starting point for almost all beer recipes. Smooth with a less grainy more moderate flavour.

data.name: Two-Row Pilsner Malt - Belgian
data.description: This base malt is used primarily for Pilsner style beers.  Base malt for Continental lagers

data.name: Two-Row Pilsner Malt - Germany
data.description: This base malt is used primarily for Pilsner style beers.  Pilsner/Bohemian Lager Base

data.name: Two-Row Pilsner Malt - UK
data.description: This base malt is used primarily for Pilsner style beers. Pilsner base malt

data.name: Victory Malt
data.description: Toasted malt that adds a "Nutty", "Biscuit", "Baking Bread" and/or toasted flavor to English ales.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Biscuit
characteristics.description: Imparts a biscuity quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Nutty
characteristics.description: Imparts a nutty flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Vienna Malt
data.description: Vienna Malt is a kiln-dried barley malt darker than pale ale malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt. It imparts a golden to orange color and a distinctive toast or biscuit malt aroma to the beer.

data.name: Wheat Malt - Dark
data.description: Dark malted wheat base for use in dark wheat styles such as Dunkleweizen.

data.name: Wheat Malt - German
data.description: Malted wheat base for use in all wheat styles.

data.name: Wheat Malt - White
data.description: White wheat gives a malty flavor not available from raw wheat.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.
